publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

seg.seg: You have here asked each [and] every monk (down to the youngest(?)) to ordain [you]. But now you shall ask the community as a whole
to ordain [you]. If the community as a whole (agrees by sitting still), you will be ordained. [If only] one [single] monk
If the whole saṃgha (agrees), [even if] only (through remaining silent), you will be ordained. If only one monk stops you, you cannot be ordained.
hinders you, you will not be ordained. What words I give you now [and] here to say, this say loudly, for the hearing of the whole community!
The words which I tell you to say, say that aloud!
Say: Let (the venerable community) pay heed to this! I, Yaśakāma, Yaśa’s [= abbrev. of Vimalayaśa] [candidate] to be ordained,
May the worthy saṃgha pay attention!
(ask) the community (to) ordain [me] with Yaśa [as] (upā)dhyāya. May the community lift me up, may the community enable my ordination
(out of) compassion! (This [must] be spoken three [times].) The noble community, from a loving disposition,
has, by sitting still, agreed to ordain you. (Let the venerable) community (hear)! I, Yaśakāma, Yaśa’s [candidate] wishing to be ordained,
(ask) the community (for) [my] ord(ination). May the community lift me up, may the community ordain
me out of compassion. Thus (a second [and] a third time) [it must] be (spoken). 3. But now the being to be ordained shall
(be asked) about obstacles. Why so? Because at the time of the Buddha, some beings, who

p.note: The supplementation and commentaries follow 20, 138-139.

TB: aiśai te yāmträ (aṣanīke sāṅk) ñiś yaśakāme yaśentse wasanpāt yamaṣälle • su ñiś saṅkameṃ wasanpāt y(askaskemar upā)dhyāyeṃ yaśentsa • kauc ñiś sāṅk pannoy yātäṣṣi ñi sāṅk wasanpāt āñmālāśälyñe(sa)

Skt.: (samanvāharatu bhadan)t(a) saṃghaḥ ahaṃ yaśakāma yaśasy=opasa(ṃ)patprekṣī so ‘haṃ saṃghād up(asaṃpadaṃ yācā)mi --------------------- avalaṃbatu māṃ saṃghaḥ upasaṃpā〈da〉yatu māṃ 〈saṃ〉ghaḥ anukampām upādāya
According to : iv-v this ms. comes either from Qizil or from Tumšuq.
From this leaf 2 large fragments are preserved: one from the left side, about 10 cm wide, and the right half of the leaf, about 13 cm wide. In between about 6 cm are missing.

The original ms. was 29 cm wide and 5.6 cm high, with the string hole 6.5 cm from the left margin. It was written by at least three hands: scribe 1, a beautiful, delicate script, from leaf 1 to 11 a1; scribe 2, distinguished by a number of orthographical idiosyncrasies/errors, from leaf 11 a1 to and including 19; scribe 3 from leaf 20 to end. The final leaves A and B and may have been written either by scribe 2 or a fourth hand. Cf. : v, 2, 4
The leaf is in hand 3.
yamaṣäle for yamaṣṣälle; ta for tane; ṣṣeme for ṣeme; wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt.
na sic! Perhaps one should read ta, as a scribal error for tane? ṣṣeme sic!
The gap contains about 10 akṣaras.
yaskaṣälle for yaskaṣṣälle; krui for kwri; wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; yātaṃñ-c for yātaṃ-c; teṅkäñ-c for teṅkäṃ-c.
The gap contains about 6 akṣaras.
teṅkäṃ is the initially accented 3rdSub.Sg. II of täṅk- ‘hinder’.
wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; yātaṃñ-c for yātaṃ-c; weñau-ś for weñau-c.-
The gap contains about 3-4 akṣaras.
klyaussa for klyauṣtsisa; wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; yamaṣälle for yamaṣṣälle.
klyaussa sic! scribal error for klyaussisa.
The gap contains about 6 akṣaras.
The Tocharian text from aiśai te yāmträ to āñmālāṣäly(ñ)e(sa) is the translation of the Sanskrit text following in lines b2-4 (for a further parallel cf. also the Bhī 19 a2-4):
wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt.

kauc pannoy corresponds to Skt. avalaṃbatu; as a Skt. equivalent, however, one would rather expect ulluṃpatu ‘shall lift’, which, indeed, is attested in Bhī 133, 17 (= a3) and the Vinayapiṭaka II, p. 277 in the same context.
The gap contains 4 akṣaras.
yātäṣṣi wasanpāt translates Skt. upasaṃpā〈da〉yatu.
wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; āñmālāśälyñesa for añmalāṣṣälñese.
āñmālāṣälyñe sic!
The gap contains about 7 akṣaras.
wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt.
saṃghaḥ ahaṃ yaśakāma sic! Class.Skt. saṃgho 'haṃ yaśakāmo.
The gap contains 6 akṣaras.
Below up(a-) the akṣara śa seems to have been inserted - where this is supposed to belong remains unclear. upasaṃpāyatu sic! scribal error for upasaṃpādayatu.
māṃghaḥ: scribal error for māṃ sāṃghaḥ.
The gap contains 7 akṣaras.
pkänte for pkante.
The gap contains about 6 akṣaras.

list.item: a1 You have here asked each [and] every monk (down to the youngest(?)) to ordain [you]. But now you shall ask the community as a whole a2 to ordain [you]. If the community as a whole (agrees by sitting still), you will be ordained. [If only] one [single] monk a3 hinders you, you will not be ordained. What words I give you now [and] here to say, this say loudly, for the hearing of the whole community! a4 Say: Let (the venerable community) pay heed to this! I, Yaśakāma, Yaśa’s [= abbrev. of Vimalayaśa] [candidate] to be ordained, a5 (ask) the community (to) ordain [me] with Yaśa [as] (upā)dhyāya. May the community lift me up, may the community enable my ordination b1 (out of) compassion! (This [must] be spoken three [times].) The noble community, from a loving disposition, b2 has, by sitting still, agreed to ordain you. (Let the venerable) community (hear)! I, Yaśakāma, Yaśa’s [candidate] wishing to be ordained, b3 (ask) the community (for) [my] ord(ination). May the community lift me up, may the community ordain b4 me out of compassion. Thus (a second [and] a third time) [it must] be (spoken). 3. But now the being to be ordained shall b5 (be asked) about obstacles. Why so? Because at the time of the Buddha, some beings, who

According to [[Schmidt KT 1986]]: iv-v this ms. comes either from Qizil or from Tumšuq.

From this leaf 2 large fragments are preserved: one from the left side, about 10 cm wide, and the right half of the leaf, about 13 cm wide. In between about 6 cm are missing.

The original ms. was 29 cm wide and 5.6 cm high, with the string hole 6.5 cm from the left margin. It was written by at least three hands: scribe 1, a beautiful, delicate script, from leaf 1 to 11 a1; scribe 2, distinguished by a number of orthographical idiosyncrasies/errors, from leaf 11 a1 to and including 19; scribe 3 from leaf 20 to end. The final leaves A and B [[THT 1123]] and [[THT 1124]] may have been written either by scribe 2 or a fourth hand. Cf. [[Schmidt KT 1986]]: v, 2, 4

The leaf is in hand 3.

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2-3 If the whole saṃgha (agrees), [even if] only (through remaining silent), you will be ordained. If only one monk stops you, you cannot be ordained. 311
a3 The words which I tell you to say, say that aloud! 659
a4 May the worthy saṃgha pay attention! 296

I changed transliteration b1 "_\" to "\" (2x). –Martin (Sat, 2019-09-28, 19:33:38 (CEST))

yamaṣṣälle|(yama)|ṣäle a1 • ta«ne» ṣeme ṣeme|ṣṣeme ṣamā(nenmeṃ) /// /// wasaṃpāt|(wa)s(a)npāt yaṣṣātai • ñake no ysomo saṅkameṃ wasaṃpāt|wasa|npāt a2 yaskaṣṣälle|yaskaṣälle star-c • kwri|kr_ui ysomo s(āṅ)k /// /// ka wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt yātaṃ-c|yātaṃñ-c • ṣe ṣamāne postaññe teṅkäṃ-c|te|ṅkäñ-c a3 wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt mā yātaṃ-c|yāt(aṃñ-c) /// /// ce rekauna weñau-c|weñau-ś wentsi tu wektse poñ po saṅkantse|saṅka|tse a4 klyauṣtsisa|klyaussa || poñ ce aiśai te yāmträ /// /// ñiś yaśakāme yaśentse wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt yamaṣṣälle|yamaṣä|lle a5 • su ñiś saṅkameṃ wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt y(askaskemar upā)dhyāyeṃ yaśentsa • kauc ñiś sāṅk pannoy yātäṣṣi b1 ñi sāṅk wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt añmalāṣṣälñesa|āñmālāśälyñe(sa) /// /// || w(är)pāte-c klyomo sāṅk täṅwañeñcai palskosa|palsko|sa b2 ām lmorsa ka wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt yāmtsi /// /// (bhadan)t(a) saṃghaḥ ahaṃ yaśakāma yaśasyopasaṃpatprekṣī|yaśasyopasa(ṃ)|patprekṣī b3 so haṃ saṃghād up(asaṃpadaṃ yācā)mi avalaṃbatu māṃ saṃghaḥ upasaṃpāyatu {s}āṃ- b4 -ghaḥ anukampām upādāya evaṃ (dv)i(r) /// /// (vakta)vyam 3 || ñake no wasaṃpāt|wasanpāt yamalyepi onolmentse|ono|lmentse b5 pkänte-yamiññana wä(ntarwa) /// /// (kā)ttsi ce pañäkte prekesa ṣemi onolmi • k_use

a1 _ṣ_ale • ta ṣeme ṣṣeme ṣamā /// /// [s]·npāt yaṣṣātai • ñake no ysomo saṅkameṃ wasa a2 npāt yaska_ṣ_alle star-c[\] • kr_ui ysomo [s]· ·[_k] /// /// ka wasanpā_t\ yātaṃñ-cä\ • ṣe ṣamāne postaññe te a3 ṅ_k_añ-cä\ wasanpā_t\ mā yāt· /// /// [c]e rekauna weñau-ś wentsi tu wektse poñä\• po saṅka a4 tse klyaussa || poñ ce aiśai te yāmt_r_a /// /// [ñ]iśä\ yaśakāme yaśentse wasanpāt\ yama_ṣ_a a5 lle • su ñiś\ saṅkameṃ wasanpā_t\ [y]· /// /// dhyā[yeṃ] yaśen[t]sa • kaucä\ ñiś\ sāṅ_k\ pannoyä\ yā_t_aṣṣi b1 ñi sāṅ_k\ wasanpā_t\ āñmālā_ś_aly[ñ]e /// /// [|| w·] ·p[ā]te-c\ klyomo sāṅ_k\ _t_aṅwañeñcai palsko b2 sa ā_m\ lmorsa ka wasanpā_t\ yāmtsi /// /// ·t· saṃghaḥ ahaṃ yaśakāma yaśasyopasa· b3 patprekṣī so haṃ saṃghād u[p]· – – – – – mi avalaṃbatu māṃ saṃghaḥ upasaṃpāyatu mā[ṃ] b4 ghaḥ anukampām upādāya evaṃ ·[i] /// /// [v]yam\• 3 || ñake no wasanpāt yamalyepi ono b5 lmentse p_k_ante-yamiññana [w]ä /// /// [tts]i ce pañäkte prekesa ṣemi onolmi • k_use

[[IDP]]: THT 1113, [[THT|TITUS]]: THT 1113.
Edition: [[Tamai 2014]]: 379-380; [[Tamai 2007a]]: №1113; [[Schmidt KT 1986]]: 20, 54-55.
Complete Translation: [[Tamai 2014]]: 379-381; [[Schmidt KT 1986]]: 88-89.
Translation: a2-3 [[Peyrot, ToSu]]: 311; a3 [[Peyrot, ToSu]]: 659; a4 [[Peyrot, ToSu]]: 296.

a1. yamaṣäle for yamaṣṣälle; ta for tane; ṣṣeme for ṣeme; wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt.
a2. yaskaṣälle for yaskaṣṣälle; krui for kwri; wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; yātaṃñ-c for yātaṃ-c; teṅkäñ-c for teṅkäṃ-c.
a3. wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; yātaṃñ-c for yātaṃ-c; weñau-ś for weñau-c.-
a4. klyaussa for klyauṣtsisa; wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; yamaṣälle for yamaṣṣälle.
a5. wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt.
b1. wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt; āñmālāśälyñesa for añmalāṣṣälñese.
b2. wasanpāt for wasaṃpāt.
b5. pkänte for pkante.


a1. na sic! Perhaps one should read ta, as a scribal error for tane? ṣṣeme sic!

a2, a3 teṅkäṃ is the initially accented 3rdSub.Sg. II of täṅk- ‘hinder’.

a4. klyaussa sic! scribal error for klyaussisa.

a5. kauc pannoy corresponds to Skt. avalaṃbatu; as a Skt. equivalent, however, one would rather expect ulluṃpatu ‘shall lift’, which, indeed, is attested in Bhī 133, 17 (= [[THT 1111]] a3) and the Vinayapiṭaka II, p. 277 in the same context.

a5, b1. yātäṣṣi wasanpāt translates Skt. upasaṃpā〈da〉yatu.

b1. āñmālāṣälyñe sic!

b2. saṃghaḥ ahaṃ yaśakāma sic! Class.Skt. saṃgho 'haṃ yaśakāmo.

b3. Below up(a-) the akṣara śa seems to have been inserted - where this is supposed to belong remains unclear. upasaṃpāyatu sic! scribal error for upasaṃpādayatu.

b3-4. māṃghaḥ: scribal error for māṃ sāṃghaḥ.
Hannes A. Fellner (in collaboration with Theresa Illés)

Transliteration

a1. The gap contains about 10 akṣaras.

a2. The gap contains about 6 akṣaras.

a3. The gap contains about 3-4 akṣaras.

a4. The gap contains about 6 akṣaras.

a5. The gap contains 4 akṣaras.

b1. The gap contains about 7 akṣaras.

b2. The gap contains 6 akṣaras.

b4. The gap contains 7 akṣaras.

b5. The gap contains about 6 akṣaras.

Transcription

The supplementation and commentaries follow [[Schmidt KT 1986]]: 20, 138-139.

a4-b1. The Tocharian text from aiśai te yāmträ to āñmālāṣäly(ñ)e(sa) is the translation of the Sanskrit text following in lines b2-4 (for a further parallel cf. also the Bhī 19 a2-4):

TB: aiśai te yāmträ (aṣanīke sāṅk) ñiś yaśakāme yaśentse wasanpāt yamaṣälle • su ñiś saṅkameṃ wasanpāt y(askaskemar upā)dhyāyeṃ yaśentsa • kauc ñiś sāṅk pannoy yātäṣṣi ñi sāṅk wasanpāt āñmālāśälyñe(sa)

Skt.: (samanvāharatu bhadan)t(a) saṃghaḥ ahaṃ yaśakāma yaśasy=opasa(ṃ)patprekṣī so ‘haṃ saṃghād up(asaṃpadaṃ yācā)mi --------------------- avalaṃbatu māṃ saṃghaḥ upasaṃpā〈da〉yatu māṃ 〈saṃ〉ghaḥ anukampām upādāya
